    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createPurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
      Creates a purchase item for in app purchases.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/create

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
      The application key that the purchase can be used in SirqulKeys.name
      The name of the purchase item SirqulKeys.description
      The description of the purchase item SirqulKeys.tickets
      How much the purchase item is worth in tickets SirqulKeys.price
      How much the purchase item will cost in real money SirqulKeys.purchaseType
      The purchase provider SIRQUL - the Sirqul store to make purchases using tickets IOS - the iTunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch GOOGLE - the Google Play store AMAZON - the Amazon Android store MAC - the iTunes store for OSX WP8 - the Windows Phone 8 store FREE - used for purchase items that are free (can be used for development/testing purposes) SirqulKeys.purchaseCode
      The unique identifier used by purchase providers to identify in-app-purchases SirqulKeys.secretKey
      A secret key from purchase providers that would be used for validation SirqulKeys.purchaseLimit
      How many times a user acquire the same purchase item SirqulKeys.serviceAction
      Determines whether the purchase item will enable certain features DAY_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a day of membership WEEK_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a week of membership MONTH_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a month of membership ADD_TICKET - allows a user to add more tickets to their account ADD_GIFT - allows a user to send/recieve the purchase item as a gift SirqulKeys.coverAssetId
      The cover image of the purchase item SirqulKeys.promoAssetId
      An application specific asset that can be used to store/provide additional data SirqulKeys.giftable
      Determines whether the purchase item can be gifted to other users SirqulKeys.assetable
      Determines whether users can attach their own media/asset to the purchase item
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
      void deletePurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
      Marks the purchase item as deleted.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/delete

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.purchaseItemId
      The purchase item id
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/search

    • Method Detail

      • createPurchaseItem

        public void createPurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params,
                      ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
        Creates a purchase item for in app purchases.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key that the purchase can be used in
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.description
          The description of the purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.tickets
          How much the purchase item is worth in tickets
        • SirqulKeys.price
          How much the purchase item will cost in real money
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseType
          The purchase provider
          • SIRQUL - the Sirqul store to make purchases using tickets
          • IOS - the iTunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
          • GOOGLE - the Google Play store
          • AMAZON - the Amazon Android store
          • MAC - the iTunes store for OSX
          • WP8 - the Windows Phone 8 store
          • FREE - used for purchase items that are free (can be used for development/testing purposes)
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseCode
          The unique identifier used by purchase providers to identify in-app-purchases
        • SirqulKeys.secretKey
          A secret key from purchase providers that would be used for validation
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseLimit
          How many times a user acquire the same purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.serviceAction
          Determines whether the purchase item will enable certain features
          • DAY_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a day of membership
          • WEEK_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a week of membership
          • MONTH_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a month of membership
          • ADD_TICKET - allows a user to add more tickets to their account
          • ADD_GIFT - allows a user to send/recieve the purchase item as a gift
        • SirqulKeys.coverAssetId
          The cover image of the purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.promoAssetId
          An application specific asset that can be used to store/provide additional data
        • SirqulKeys.giftable
          Determines whether the purchase item can be gifted to other users
        • SirqulKeys.assetable
          Determines whether users can attach their own media/asset to the purchase item

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        PurchaseItemObject.createPurchaseItem

      • deletePurchaseItem

        public void deletePurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params,
                      ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Marks the purchase item as deleted.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/delete

        Available parameters for this api

          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseItemId
          The purchase item id

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • searchPurchaseItems

        public void searchPurchaseItems(Map<String,Object> params,
                       ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
        Search for purchasable items from the system.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key to filter results by application
        • SirqulKeys.filterByBillable
          Determines whether to filter results by the user's billable entity
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseTypes
          the purchase types
        • SirqulKeys.serviceActions
          the service actions
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on. Possible values include: ID, CREATED, UPDATED, ACTIVE, ACTIVATED, EXPIRES, TITLE, SUBTITLE, DETAILS, OFFER_TYPE, SPECIAL_OFFER_TYPE, OFFER_VISIBILITY, ESTIMATED_VALUE, VOUCHER_PRICE, RETAILER_ID, RETAILER_NAME, RETAILER_LOCATION_ID, RETAILER_LOCATION_NAME, BILLABLE_ENTITY_ID, BILLABLE_ENTITY_NAME, RESPONSIBLE_DISPLAY
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the search results
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Return only active results

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        PurchaseItemObject.searchPurchaseItems

      • updatePurchaseItem

        public void updatePurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params,
                      ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
        Updates a purchase item for in app purchases.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseItemId
          The purchase item id
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.description
          The description of the purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.tickets
          How much the purchase item is worth in tickets
        • SirqulKeys.price
          How much the purchase item will cost in real money
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseType
          The purchase provider
          • SIRQUL - the Sirqul store to make purchases using tickets
          • IOS - the iTunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
          • GOOGLE - the Google Play store
          • AMAZON - the Amazon Android store
          • MAC - the iTunes store for OSX
          • WP8 - the Windows Phone 8 store
          • FREE - used for purchase items that are free (can be used for development/testing purposes)
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseCode
          The unique identifier used by purchase providers to identify in-app-purchases
        • SirqulKeys.secretKey
          A secret key from purchase providers that would be used for validation
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseLimit
          How many times a user acquire the same purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.serviceAction
          Determines whether the purchase item will enable certain features
          • DAY_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a day of membership
          • WEEK_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a week of membership
          • MONTH_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a month of membership
          • ADD_TICKET - allows a user to add more tickets to their account
          • ADD_GIFT - allows a user to send/recieve the purchase item as a gift
        • SirqulKeys.coverAssetId
          The cover image of the purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.promoAssetId
          An application specific asset that can be used to store/provide additional data
        • SirqulKeys.giftable
          Determines whether the purchase item can be gifted to other users
        • SirqulKeys.assetable
          Determines whether users can attach their own media/asset to the purchase item
        • SirqulKeys.active
          Sets whether the purchase item is active or inactive (hidden from consumers)

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
